nodes.bodyText:
As per BAPL-1526 description (queryCaseTaks), I'm missing the following attributes/members:

processDefinitionId
processInstanceId

processDefinitionId <- caseDefinitionID
processInstanceId <- CaseId There
Shouldn't these members be annotated with the @xmlelement(name = "..") annotation like CaseInstanceCustomVars class?
Are we not providing more detailed info than what it is expected as per BAPL-1526 (queryCases)? or am I missing something?
removed unused fields.
Shouldn't these members be annotated with the @xmlelement(name = "..") annotation like CaseInstanceCustomVars class?
Shouldn't these members be declared as private accesor instead of default?

If this class is the equivalent for queryProcessTasks (as per BAPL-1526), I'm missing some attributes like:

caseDefinitionId (maybe this is not valid as this is a process and not a case?)
caseInstanceId (maybe this is not valid as this is a process and not a case?)
taskInputVariables - I guess this is matched with inputVariables member of this class? wouldn't make sense to rename it to taskInputVariable? wdyt?

I'm missing a class for the queryProcess query as per BAPL-1526.
So far we have defined the following classes:

CaseInstanceCustomVars class - for queryCases search.
CaseUserTaskWithVariables class - for queryCaseTasks search.
ProcessInstanceUserTaskWithVariables class for queryProcessTasks search.

What about a class for "queryProcesses" search?
ProcessInstanceCustomVarsList and ProcessInstanceCustomVars
Just out of curiosity, why these are not supported?
Doesn't make sense to implement toString method? - since I see some of these objects are logged when log level is set to debug (to avoid printing a useless message)
ok
Shouldn't we call to something meaningful like convertToCaseInstanceCustomVarsList? convertToProcessInstanceCustomVarsList is not really what this method returns.
Shouldn't this method be renamed to something meaningful like convertToCaseInstanceCustomVarsList? It doesn't return a ProcessInstanceCustomVarsList object.
done
can't we use parallelStrem()?
it does not make sense to spawn new threads in new context. Also it will change the order.

I would add some search criteria in both queries, just to make sure queries are returning expected values, like attributes, task input variables, process variables, etc.
I would also add some pagination.

I would add some search criteria in both queries, just to make sure queries are returning expected values, like attributes, task input variables, process variables, etc.
I would also add some pagination.
done
Would it make sense to have a name like "cases" rather than "processes"? wdyt?
done
